Tariffs: EU hands Trump a political win to avoid trade chaos
subhead: Ursula von der Leyen and Donald Trump reached an agreement imposing a 15% tariff on most European products imported to the US. The 27 EU member states also committed to purchasing more American oil and gas, and to investing in the country.

title: Armenian prime minister and church leader clash over opposing visions for country's future
subhead: Nikol Pashinyan, the head of government, angered the highest dignitary of the Armenian Apostolic Church, Karekin II, by focusing on 'real Armenia' within its current, internationally recognized borders. The two men are at odds with each other and have each called for the other's resignation.
byline: By Faustine Vincent (Etchmiadzin and Yerevan, special correspondent)

title: Tadej Pogacar, a Tour de France champion weary of his own dominance
subhead: The 26-year-old Slovenian cyclist claimed victory in the race on Sunday for the fourth time in his career. He finished over four minutes ahead of his rival Jonas Vingegaard in the overall standings, with the Dane unable to threaten his lead.

Is there a genocide in Gaza? Why legal experts are split
subhead: Genocide, as defined by the 1948 convention, requires both certain criminal acts to be committed and genocidal intent. While the requisite acts have been proven in Gaza, legal scholars are divided over the intent. South Africa has filed a genocide complaint against Israel with the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

title: Novelist Peter Handke: 'To die in the middle of writing a book, that would be magnificent!'
subhead: The Austrian writer and 2019 Nobel Prize in Literature laureate looks back on nearly 60 years of his career, discussing the twists and turns of the desire to write, which continue to drive him to this day.
